org.tinfour.gis.shapefile

Class DbfField

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tinfour.gis.shapefile.DbfField
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DbfFieldDate, DbfFieldDouble, DbfFieldInt

    public class DbfField
extends Object
    Provides definitions and access methods for a DBF field.

    A number of features are not yet supported. Only the data types C (character), N (numeric) and F (floating-point) are supported. Only iso-8859-1 character sets are supported.

    • Method Detail

      • isIntegral

        public boolean isIntegral()
        Indicates whether the field supports integral data value type.
        Returns:
        true if the field can return an integer; otherwise, false

      • getInteger

        public int getInteger()
        Gets the integer value of the field, if it is of an integral type, otherwise returns a zero.
        Returns:
        a valid integral value, or a zero if undefined.

      • getDouble

        public double getDouble()
        Gets the double value stored in the field during the most recent read operation, if any
        Returns:
        a valid double or a NaN if this is not a numeric field

      • getString

        public String getString()
        Gets the string value stored in the field during the most recent read operation.
        Returns:
        a valid string, potentially empty

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Gets the name of the data field
        Returns:
        a valid string

      • getFieldType

        public char getFieldType()
        Indicates the type of the data field as defined in the DBF spec.
        Returns:
        a single character as defined in the DBF spec.

      • getFieldLength

        public int getFieldLength()
        Indicates the overall length of the data field
        Returns:
        the fieldLength

      • getFieldDecimalCount

        public int getFieldDecimalCount()
        For numeric fields, indicates the number of decimal digits.
        Returns:
        the fieldDecimalCount

      • isNumeric

        public boolean isNumeric()
        Indicates if the field defines a numeric value
        Returns:
        the numeric

      • getLogicalValue

        public boolean getLogicalValue()
        Gets a logical value.
        Returns:
        true if the field contains a logical value of TRUE; otherwise false.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • getApplicationData

        public Object getApplicationData()
        Gets the data for the field as an Object of the appropriate class. For the DbdField base class, the return value is a string. For others, the return type may vary.
        Returns:
        an object, potentially null if the record has not been read.

      • usesEngineeringNotation

        public boolean usesEngineeringNotation()
        Indicates whether the value in the field was encoded using engineering notation (e.g. scientific notation). The return value will be false for all field types except floating-point types.
        Returns:
        true if engineering notation was used; otherwise false.

      • getUniqueValues

        public List<String> getUniqueValues(DbfFileReader dbf)
                             throws IOException
        Gets the unique values for this field as a list of strings.
        Parameters:
        dbf - the DBF with which this field is associated
        Returns:
        if successful, a valid list of unique values
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of an unrecoverable IO condition.

      • isNull

        public boolean isNull()
        Indicates whether the field contains a null value. Because the interpretation of null fields is not well defined by the DBF file specification, this method should be used with care.
        Returns:
        true if the field is empty, otherwise false.
